DOC.brief_summary: It was hypothesized that eating a meal slowly would lead to a lower meal energy intake and lesser feelings of hunger and desire to eat and higher levels of fullness after the meal compared to eating the same meal more quickly.
DOC.brief_title: The Effect of Changing the Eating Speed on Energy Intake
